thread.title: Jason Manford's joy that he is his daughter's 'hero' after he feared he'd 'f****d things up'
thread.title_full: Jason Manford's joy that he is his daughter's 'hero' after he feared he'd 'f****d things up'

author: Jon Macpherson
title: Jason Manford's joy that he is his daughter's 'hero' after he feared he'd 'f****d things up'
text:
Jason Manford's joy that he is his daughter's 'hero' after he feared he'd 'f****d things up' The comedian posted a picture of his daughter dressed as him for a school Super Hero Day Share Get daily   
Comedian Jason Manford has spoken of his pride that he’s his daughter’s ‘hero’ after fearing he had ‘f****d things up’. 
The Salford-born comic posted the heartfelt message with fans on his Facebook page after one of his daughters decided to dress like him for a school ‘Super Hero Day.’ Read More Teenage lesbian couple 'told off by security guard for putting people off their food' after kiss in Morrisons cafe 
The picture showed his daughter - with a blurred out face - looking like a chip off the old block as she donned black trousers, a brightly patterned shirt and grasping a microphone. 
Jason, 35, wrote: “Okay, so I know this is a brag and well, I never do this, but whatever! But today was Super Hero Day at my children’s school where all the kids had to go as a hero character or their hero. 
“Athough one of my daughters went as -Fantastic Cat Girl”, my other daughter went as me, her dad! Read More Comedy Store Manchester named Best Comedy Club in the CityLife Awards 2016 
“I know it’s cheesy, but after becoming a single dad and all the other times I f****d things up or thought I wasn’t being the best man that I could be; this is the kind of thing that means the world to me! 
“I just have to make sure that I keep being the person she thinks I am!” Jason Manford 
Fans and parents praised the TV favourite for his candid post with some even sharing similar pictures of their little one’s dressed as them. 
Neville Brown wrote: “I feel your joy Jason ....my son did exactly the same thing a few weeks ago ...I was so proud and shed a little tear fella ....big fan of yours , keep up the good work.” 
Sally Ive wrote: “Love it ... my daughter also did this for her super hero day ... daddy is a hero because he makes the electrics work lol xx I always tell my girls that one day their prince may come but daddy will always be king.” WATCH: Jason Manford launches new comedy club Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
